content: 1 k32 33 35 36 37 kfb k1 turn round 1 *k2 p2 repeat from * to end of round for stitch counts 64 68 72 only repeat round 1 until the cuff measures 2 inches or desired length round 2 ds p16 pfb p1 turn round 3 ds k15 kfb k1 turn bindoffallsts ensuringenoughstretchtobeableto put the sock on and maintain blood supply for all sizes reward with copious amounts of chocolate or knit a round 4 ds p14 pfb p1 turn second sock whichever suits round 5 ds k13 kfb k1 turn 2 sizing note the trickiest part of knitting socks once you have knit a few pairs and have the basic techniques down is knitting socks that fit to knit socks that fit you first need to know the length you are aiming for i use a shoe size converter chart as i lose anything more complicated i m a uk size 6 so i knit my socks to measure 9 5 inches the second thing you need to know is when to put in your heel for this pattern you will work a total of 34 34 36 36 36 rounds for the gusset and heel at a gauge of 12 rounds per inch as given in the pattern this is equivalent to 34 =2 8 inches 12 for the 56 and 60 st socks for the 64 68 and 72 st socks this works out to be 36 =3 inches 12 hence the pattern says to knit your sock until it measures 2 8 2 8 3 3 3 inches less than your desired length soifiwasknittinga64stsockandiwantedittomeasure9 5 inches iwouldknituntilmysockmeasured 9 5 - 3 = 6 5 inches and then start the gusset increases but what if you re not getting the gauge the pattern is written for just swap the 12 rounds per inch for your actual gauge for instance if i m knitting a 56 st sock and getting a gauge of 14 rounds per inch i would work 34 =2 4 inches 14 less than desired length and that s it no more guessing about when to put in your heel hopefully this limits how many times you need to re-knit a heel so that it fits just right 3
